types.import: Body can be set as a stream to send data to clients.

type.name: ContextDelegatedResponse
type.desc: The response API available via Context.
type.fn: The filename. Options. Set Content-Disposition header to "attachment" with optional `filename`.

The URL to redirect to.
The referrer to set when redirecting.
Perform a 302 redirect to `url`. The string "back" is special-cased to provide Referrer support, when Referrer is not present `alt` or "/" is used.
_Examples_:
```js this.redirect('back') this.redirect('back', '/index.html') this.redirect('/login') this.redirect('http://google.com') ```
The name of the header to remove. Remove header `field`.

The field to set, or an object of header fields.
The value to set, when passing a single field.
Set header `field` to `val`, or pass an object of header fields.
_Examples_:
```js this.set('Foo', ['bar', 'baz']) this.set('Accept', 'application/json') this.set({ Accept: 'text/plain', 'X-API-Key': 'tobi' }) ```
The name of the header to vary on. Vary on `field`.

type="function(string, (string|!Array)): void" The header name to append values to. The value or values to append. Append additional header `field` with value `val`.
_Examples_:
```js this.append('Link', ['', '']) this.append('Set-Cookie', 'foo=bar; Path=/; HttpOnly') this.append('Warning', '199 Miscellaneous warning') ```
Flush any set headers, and begin the body.
type.prop: Return parsed response `Content-Length` when present. Set `Content-Length` field to `n`.

Return the response mime type void of parameters such as "charset". Set Content-Type response header with `type` through `mime.lookup()` when it does not contain a charset.
_Examples_:
```js this.type = '.html' this.type = 'html' this.type = 'json' this.type = 'application/json' this.type = 'png' ```
Checks if the request is writable. Tests for the existence of the socket as _Node.JS_ sometimes does not set it.

Get the Last-Modified date in Date form, if it exists. Set the Last-Modified date using a string or a Date.
_Examples_:
```js this.response.lastModified = new Date() this.response.lastModified = '2013-09-13' ```
Check if a header has been written to the socket.

Get/Set the ETag of a response. This will normalize the quotes if necessary.
_Examples_:
```js this.response.etag = 'md5hashsum' this.response.etag = '"md5hashsum"' this.response.etag = 'W/"123456789"' ```

type.desc: The additional API not available via Context.
